name: Interpersonal Reactivity Index
description: A 28-item measure of dispositional empathy with four subscales: Perspective Taking, Fantasy, Empathic Concern, and Personal Distress. One of the most widely used empathy measures in psychology.
reference: Davis, M. H. (1983). Measuring individual differences in empathy: Evidence for a multidimensional approach. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 44(1), 113-126.
instructions: The following statements inquire about your thoughts and feelings in a variety of situations. For each item, indicate how well it describes you.

questions.name: iri_1
questions.description: I daydream and fantasize, with some regularity, about things that might happen to me.

questions.name: iri_2
questions.description: I often have tender, concerned feelings for people less fortunate than me.

questions.name: iri_3
questions.description: I sometimes find it difficult to see things from the 'other guy's' point of view.

questions.name: iri_4
questions.description: Sometimes I don't feel very sorry for other people when they are having problems.

questions.name: iri_5
questions.description: I really get involved with the feelings of the characters in a novel.

questions.name: iri_6
questions.description: In emergency situations, I feel apprehensive and ill-at-ease.

questions.name: iri_7
questions.description: I am usually objective when I watch a movie or play, and I don't often get completely caught up in it.

questions.name: iri_8
questions.description: I try to look at everybody's side of a disagreement before I make a decision.

questions.name: iri_9
questions.description: When I see someone being taken advantage of, I feel kind of protective towards them.

questions.name: iri_10
questions.description: I sometimes feel helpless when I am in the middle of a very emotional situation.

questions.name: iri_11
questions.description: I sometimes try to understand my friends better by imagining how things look from their perspective.

questions.name: iri_12
questions.description: Becoming extremely involved in a good book or movie is somewhat rare for me.

questions.name: iri_13
questions.description: When I see someone get hurt, I tend to remain calm.

questions.name: iri_14
questions.description: Other people's misfortunes do not usually disturb me a great deal.

questions.name: iri_15
questions.description: If I'm sure I'm right about something, I don't waste much time listening to other people's arguments.

questions.name: iri_16
questions.description: After seeing a play or movie, I have felt as though I were one of the characters.

questions.name: iri_17
questions.description: Being in a tense emotional situation scares me.

questions.name: iri_18
questions.description: When I see someone being treated unfairly, I sometimes don't feel very much pity for them.

questions.name: iri_19
questions.description: I am usually pretty effective in dealing with emergencies.

questions.name: iri_20
questions.description: I am often quite touched by things that I see happen.

questions.name: iri_21
questions.description: I believe that there are two sides to every question and try to look at them both.

questions.name: iri_22
questions.description: I would describe myself as a pretty soft-hearted person.

questions.name: iri_23
questions.description: When I watch a good movie, I can very easily put myself in the place of a leading character.

questions.name: iri_24
questions.description: I tend to lose control during emergencies.

questions.name: iri_25
questions.description: When I'm upset at someone, I usually try to 'put myself in his shoes' for a while.

questions.name: iri_26
questions.description: When I am reading an interesting story or novel, I imagine how I would feel if the events in the story were happening to me.

questions.name: iri_27
questions.description: When I see someone who badly needs help in an emergency, I go to pieces.

questions.name: iri_28
questions.description: Before criticizing somebody, I try to imagine how I would feel if I were in their place.
